data.title: Bhumibol Adulyadej (1927-2016)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Bhumibol Adulyadej born 1927 Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA died 2016 Bangkok, Thailand including ancestors + descendants + 2 photos + 4 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors

Husband of [private wife (1930s - unknown)]

Descendants

Profile last modified 8 Nov 2022 | Created 14 Aug 2016

This page has been accessed 3,479 times.

Bhumibol Adulyadej is Notable.

Bhumibol Adulyadej (Thai: ภูมิพล อดุลยเดช) was King of Thailand from 1946 to 2016. He was the ninth monarch of the Chakri dynasty and thus had the official title of King Rama IX. From 1987 he was known as King Bhumibol the Great.[1]

Biography

Bhumibol was born on 5 Dec 1927 in Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA.[2]

Following the short reign and early death of his brother, King Ananda Mahidol, Bhumibol restored the power of the Thai monarchy and became deeply respected. He was known for his interest in rural development, and was almost always seen with a camera which he used to record the conditions he found.[3]

Bumibol died on 13 Oct 2016 in Bangkok[4] but was not laid to rest until 26 October 2017, when he was cremated in a Buddhist ceremony in the capital. [5][6][7]

Sources

↑ Wikipedia:Bhumibol Adulyadej

↑ Digital image of birth certificate at [1], accessed 2016-11-05. Text reads: "Commonwealth of Massachusetts. 3173. Baby Songkla. [Above this is written 'Bhumipal ('Aduldej' crossed out) Sangkla.] Date of Birth: Dec 5th 1927. Sex: Male. Color: [illegible]. Place of Birth: No. 330 Mt. Auburn Street, Cambridge. Name of Father: Mahidal [sic] Songkla. Age of Father: 35. Place of Birth of Father: Bangkok, Siam. Occupation of Father: Medical Student. Name of Mother: Sangwan Talapat. Age of Mother: 27. Place of Birth of Mother: Bangkok, Siam. Occupation of Mother: Housewife. Residence of Parents: No. 63 Longwood Ave, Brookline, Ward D. Physician personally attending birth: W. Stewart Whittermore [?] M.D."

↑ How King Bhumibol shaped modern Thailand, BBC News, Bangkok 2016-10-13

↑ Thailand's King Bhumibol Adulyadej dead at 88, BBC News, accessed 2016-10-14

↑ "Family Tree," database, FamilySearch (http://familysearch.org : modified 15 April 2019, 20:40), entry for ภูมิพล อดุลยเดช(PID https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/4:1:L5Y8-8WM); contributed by various users.

↑ "Find A Grave Index," database, FamilySearch (https://www.familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:Q2DN-HGF4 : 20 July 2020), Bhumibol Adulyadej, 2016; Burial, , ; citing record ID , Find A Grave: Memorial #171229211
